title: ICE Shooting Debate
summary: Analysis of claims surrounding recent ICE enforcement actions and related incidents, examining accuracy of statements from various sources.

claims.statement: ICE agents were shot at during a routine enforcement operation

evidenceFor.point: ICE confirmed shots were fired at agents during the operation
Local police corroborated the incident report

evidenceAgainst.point: The characterization of 'routine' is disputed; operation involved armed tactical units

claims.statement: The individual who fired at agents had no prior criminal record

evidenceAgainst.point: Court records show previous misdemeanor convictions

claims.statement: ICE enforcement operations have increased 300% under the current administration

evidenceFor.point: Arrest numbers have significantly increased compared to previous year

evidenceAgainst.point: The 300% figure applies only to specific categories, not overall operations
Methodology for counting 'operations' changed between administrations

claims.statement: Community members were not given advance warning of the operation

evidenceFor.point: ICE policy does not require advance community notification for enforcement actions
Local officials confirmed they were not informed beforehand
